page.title: 05LANTERN LANE SCHOOL
page.content: Lantern Lane school is situated off the main Gotham Road next door to the Harry Carlton Comprehensive School.It was built to accommodate children from new housing when the village first grew.Until 1966 it was the only primary school in the village and became of such a size that the original village school(now part of Brookside School) had to be used as an annexe. Now that there are two schools rolls have fallen and there are now less than 200 pupils on roll. The classrooms are large and there is ample storage space. Children enter school on the Tuesday after their fifth birthday and leave to commence their secondary education during their eleventh year. The school now has a modern nursery unit.
